titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Russia. Legatsiia (Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach, Germany) Records, 1902-1908
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Russia. Legatsiia (Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach, Germany) Records,
did.abstract: Correspondence, orders, reports, and printed matter, relating to Russian-German relations

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Russia. Legatsiia (Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach, Germany) Records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1934.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: Foreign Office political reports sent out to Russian Representatives abroad
Foreign Office orders of the day
Foreign Office correspondence, instructions and dispositions to the Weimar Legation
St. Petersburg Police Department circular letters, 1903-06
Recall of Chamberlain Baron Budberg from Weimar, 1903
Nomination of Mr. Prosor as Minister Resident in Weimar and Altenburg and his recall from, 1903-04
Correspondence between Mr. Prosor and other Russian diplomatic representatives on the subject of his nomination, 1903-04
Nomination of Baron Grewenitz as Minister Resident of Weimar, 1904-05
Correspondence regarding the remittance of credential letters to diplomatic representatives, 1903-04
Mr. Prosor's political reports, 1903-04
Baron Grewenitz's political reports, 1904-07
Corresondence regarding secret codes, 1903-06
Negotiations with the Court of the Grand Duke of Saxe-Weimar
Negotiations with the Court of the Grand Duke of Saxe-Altenburg, 1904-06
Foreign Office, St. Petersburg, political reports, 1903
Russian workmen, 1905-06
Russian students in various schools and universities, 1905
Decorations, reports pertaining to the granting of
Correspondence, general, 1903-07
